definition: to declare to be untrue/to deny

sentences.english: The President refused to either confirm or deny this rumor.
sentences.chinese: 总统拒绝证实或否认这种传闻。

sentences.english: His denial that he had witnessed the accident dumbfounded me.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾亲眼目睹这一事故的发生把我惊呆了。

sentences.english: Managers may disown their part in the appraisal system.
sentences.chinese: 管理者也许会否认在业绩排名系统里面的角色。

sentences.english: There is no denying, that as a challenger now, we have a fight on our hands.
sentences.chinese: 不可否认，我们作为挑战者，将有一场硬仗要打。

sentences.english: There was no denying that she had compromised herself irretrievably .
sentences.chinese: 她已经无可挽救地跟他妥协，那是不能否认的了。

sentences.english: I do not deny that your No. 33 bleached cotton is top quality.
sentences.chinese: 意思为我不否认你的33号漂白棉花质量是顶级的。

sentences.english: There is no gainsaying his innocence.
Massoud denies taking money out of Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 马苏德否认自己曾带钱离开阿富汗。

sentences.english: The leadership issued a statement denying any favoritism.
sentences.chinese: 公约领导层发表一份声明表示否认有任何偏袒。

sentences.english: Of course, what goes up must come down.
sentences.chinese: 当然，不可否认的是，跳上去就必定得落下来。

sentences.english: Paul, then, would seem to be contradicting Christ.
sentences.chinese: 这样，保罗似乎否认了基督。

sentences.english: There is, as we know, a philosophy which denies the infinite.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道有一种否认无极的哲学。

sentences.english: A denial of God seems so much more intelligible than a denial of the world.
sentences.chinese: 大家总是觉得否认上帝远较否认世界为更可以理解。

sentences.english: A denial of God seems so much more intelligible than a denial of the world.
sentences.chinese: 大家总是觉得否认上帝远较否认世界为更可以理解。

sentences.english: The nurses denied the charges and said they had been tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: Both firms deny any responsibility for the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司都否认对这一惨祸负有责任。

definition: to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
